item.title: Enfield council ghettoising the borough, 19th October
item.description:
I have reported the unlicensed multi occupancy, at 36 Lytton Avenue, where men arrive each day in vans, sneaking no English. Make of that what you will. The council knows this yet agreed an extension for more unlicensed multi occupants . The street is now full of lone males, parking vans on the grass verges and across the pavements illegally. Again the council know this. They have put up the most unstable scaffolding, balancing tenuously at the edge of the wall and jutting into and damaging the streets trees - which the council have a disregard of. All n all Enfield council are decimating the borough, which is now lawless.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lytton Avenue, Palmers Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Northwood House, Hamilton Road SE27 9SL –, 19th October
item.description:
Northwood House, Hamilton Road SE27 9SL – when looking head on at frontage at the left end there is a gated car park entrance – next to this is a concrete wall with a white ‘sign board’ whose lettering has disappeared – said ‘board’ is graffiti tagged. Please forward fixmystreet.com link to your contractor re attached picture and Google Streetview link: https://www.google.com/maps/@51.4287963,-0.0899174,3a,75y,169.84h,85.66t/data=!3m7!1e1!3m5!1sEIIXKMzP9XnTKJqQI09MLw!2e0!6shttps:%2F%2Fstreetviewpixels-pa.googleapis.com%2Fv1%2Fthumbnail%3Fcb_client%3Dmaps_sv.tactile%26w%3D900%26h%3D600%26pitch%3D4.342315105763333%26panoid%3DEIIXKMzP9XnTKJqQI09MLw%26yaw%3D169.84087751126557!7i16384!8i8192?authuser=0&entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI1MTAxNC4wIKXMDSoASAFQAw%3D%3D

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hamilton Road, West Norwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly-tipping and Rubbish on Badgemore Path, 19th October
item.description:
I would like to report an ongoing issue with fly-tipping and rubbish along Badgemore Path. The path is often littered with trash in the bushes, sometimes even suitcases, but more often general waste and disgusting debris. This is especially concerning because the path surrounds the school, and it is upsetting that children are exposed to this every day. Not only does it create an unpleasant and unhealthy environment, but it also risks normalising this behaviour for them, which could encourage the same habits in the future. Please could this be investigated and action taken to address the issue on a regular basis? Thank you for your attention.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Badgemore Path, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish bin parking permit, 19th October
item.description:
Several residents on this street are regularly placing household rubbish bins in resident permit bays to reserve parking spaces. This obstructs fair use of the bays and creates unnecessary clutter and hazards. The bins are often left out for extended periods, even outside of collection days. This misuse of public space undermines the resident permit system and causes tension among neighbours. Please investigate and take appropriate action to discourage this behaviour.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Goldsworthy Gardens, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This old fencing has been left fly tipped on the public Green space, 19th October
item.description:
The corner house has renewed their fencing up to a point and flt tipped the old fencing on this public Green space. It has been reported before but to no effect. The bulk is towards Horncastle Road but there is some by the Westhorne Avenue grass area adjacent to the new fence. This does the grass no good at all and means the old wood is not recycled but fly tipped for somebody else to remove. Please take enforcement action to remove and allow the grass area to recover.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Horncastle Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned/stolen and damaged bicycles left in communal walkways and stair access areas of the building, 19th October
item.description:
Several abandoned or possibly stolen bicycles have been left throughout the building’s communal areas for weeks. There are 3 on lvl 5 and at least 1 on ground floor. All are in poor condition, unlocked, and unused. They obstruct the walkways.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Well Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple Potholes - near bus stop F Heath Road (On A207 Crayford Road), 19th October
item.description:
Multiple Potholes - near bus stop F Heath Road (On A207 Crayford Road). In addition, multiple cracks crossing road surface. When riding a bicycle, these must be swerved round leading the bike into traffic. Problems are not solely at the bus stop, they are before (towards railway overbridge) and afterwards (until roundabout with Princes Road)
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crayford Road, Barnes Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet
